title: Awareness and Training
description: Security awareness and training for personnel

questions.question: Do you provide security awareness training to all users?
questions.context: Everyone who touches CUI needs to understand security risks and responsibilities.
questions.examples: Annual security training, onboarding training, security awareness program
questions.followUp: What security training do employees receive? How often? Is it documented?
questions.discussion: Security awareness training informs personnel about security risks associated with their activities and their responsibilities in adhering to organizational policies and procedures.

questions.question: Do you provide role-based security training?
questions.context: Admins, developers, and others with special access need additional specialized training.
questions.examples: Admin security training, developer secure coding, incident response team training
questions.followUp: What specialized training do IT staff get? What about managers with CUI access?
questions.discussion: Role-based training provides more detailed information for personnel with specific security responsibilities or who require additional privilege to perform their duties.
assessmentObjectives: Roles requiring specialized training are identified
whatToExamine: List of roles requiring special training
redFlags: Admins get same training as everyone
No secure coding training for developers

questions.question: Do you train users on insider threat awareness?
questions.context: Users need to recognize and report potential insider threat indicators.
questions.examples: Insider threat training module, reporting suspicious behavior, security incident reporting
questions.followUp: How do you train on insider threats? What are employees told to watch for?
questions.discussion: Insider threat training helps personnel recognize behavioral indicators of insider threat and understand their responsibility to report such observations.
